intro: Didymocarpus anningensis, commonly known as the Anning's mallow, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
